010package imagingbook.lib.ij;
011
012import java.awt.Dimension;
013import java.awt.Rectangle;
014import java.awt.Toolkit;
015import java.lang.reflect.Field;
016import java.util.ArrayList;
017import java.util.List;
018
019import ij.IJ;
020import ij.ImagePlus;
021import ij.WindowManager;
022import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
023import ij.gui.ImageCanvas;
024import ij.gui.ImageWindow;
025import ij.plugin.ScreenGrabber;
026
027/**
028 * 
029 * @author WB
030 * @version 2020/10/09
031 *
032 */
033public class GuiTools {
034        
035        public static String DEFAULT_DIALOG_TITLE = "Choose image";
036        
037        /**
038         * Queries the user to select one of the currently open images.
039         *  
040         * @param title name of the dialog window (if null, the default title is used)
041         * @param excludeIm image to exclude from being selected (typically the current image)
042         * @return a reference to the chosen image (ImagePlus) or null, if the dialog was cancelled
043         */
044    public static ImagePlus chooseOpenImage(String title, ImagePlus excludeIm) {
045                if (title == null) {
046                        title = DEFAULT_DIALOG_TITLE;
047                }
048                int[] imgIdsAll = WindowManager.getIDList();
049                if (imgIdsAll==null) {
050                        IJ.error("No images are open.");
051                        return null;
052                }
053
054                List<Integer> imgIdList   = new ArrayList<Integer>(imgIdsAll.length);   // use a Map instead?
055                List<String>  imgNameList = new ArrayList<String>(imgIdsAll.length);
056                
057                for (int id : imgIdsAll) {
058                        ImagePlus img = WindowManager.getImage(id);
059                        if (img!=null && img != excludeIm && img.isProcessor()) {
060                                imgIdList.add(id);
061                                imgNameList.add(img.getShortTitle());
062                        }
063                }
064                
065                if (imgIdList.size() < 1) {
066                        IJ.error("No other images found.");
067                        return null;
068                }
069                
070                Integer[] imgIds   = imgIdList.toArray(new Integer[0]);
071                String[]  imgNames = imgNameList.toArray(new String[0]);
072                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(title, null);
073                gd.addChoice("Image:", imgNames, imgNames[0]);  
074                gd.showDialog();
075                if (gd.wasCanceled())
076                        return null;
077                else {
078                        int idx = gd.getNextChoiceIndex();
079                        return WindowManager.getImage(imgIds[idx]);
080                }
081    }
082    
083        public static ImagePlus chooseOpenImage(String title) {
084                return chooseOpenImage(title, null);
085        }
086        
087    public static ImagePlus chooseOpenImage() {
088        return chooseOpenImage(null, null);
089    }
090    
091    // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
092    
093        /**
094         * Modifies the view of the given {@link ImagePlus} image to the specified magnification
095         * (zoom) factor and the anchor position in the source image. 
096         * The size of the image window remains unchanged.
097         * The specified anchor point is the top-left corner of the source rectangle,
098         * both coordinates must be positive.
099         * The method fails (does nothing and returns {@code null}) if the resulting 
100         * source rectangle does not fit into the image.
101         * If successful, the view is modified and the resulting source rectangle is returned.
102         * Otherwise {@code null} is returned.
103         * 
104         * @param im the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
105         * @param magnification the new magnification factor (1.0 = 100%)
106         * @param xa the x-coordinate of the anchor point
107         * @param ya the y-coordinate of the anchor point
108         * @return the resulting source rectangle if successful, {@code null} otherwise 
109         */
110        public static Rectangle setImageView(ImagePlus im, double magnification, int xa, int ya) {
111                ImageCanvas ic = im.getCanvas();
112        if (ic == null) {
113                IJ.showMessage("Image has no canvas.");
114            return null;
115        }
116        
117        Dimension d = ic.getPreferredSize();
118        int dstWidth = d.width;
119        int dstHeight = d.height;
120        
121        int imgWidth = im.getWidth();
122        int imgHeight = im.getHeight();
123        
124        if (xa < 0 || ya < 0) {
125                throw new IllegalArgumentException("anchor coordinates may not be negative!");
126        }
127        
128        if (magnification <= 0.001) {
129            throw new IllegalArgumentException("magnification value must be positive!");
130        }
131        
132        // calculate size of the new source rectangle
133        int srcWidth  = (int) Math.ceil(dstWidth / magnification); // check!!
134        int srcHeight = (int) Math.ceil(dstHeight / magnification);
135        
136        if (xa + srcWidth > imgWidth || ya + srcHeight > imgHeight) {
137                // source rectangle does not fully fit into source image
138                return null;
139        }
140        
141        Rectangle srcRect = new Rectangle(xa, ya, srcWidth, srcHeight);
142        ic.setSourceRect(srcRect);
143        im.repaintWindow();
144        
145                return srcRect;
146        }
147        
148        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
149        
150        private static final int DEFAULT_SCREEN_MARGIN_X = 10; // horizontal screen margin
151        private static final int DEFAULT_SCREEN_MARGIN_Y = 30; // vertical screen margin
152        
153        /**
154         * Resizes the window of the given image to fit an arbitrary, user-specified
155         * magnification factor.
156         * The resulting window size is limited by the current screen size.
157         * The window size is reduced if too large but the given magnification factor
158         * remains always unchanged.
159         * <br>
160         * Adapted from https://albert.rierol.net/plugins/Zoom_Exact.java
161         * Copyright Albert Cardona @ 2006
162         * General Public License applies.
163         * <br>
164         * TODO: Check calculation of source rectangle, final magnification may not always be exact!
165         * 
166         * @param im the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
167         * @param magnification the new magnification factor (1.0 = 100%)
168         * @param marginX horizontal screen margin
169         * @param marginY vertical screen margin
170         * @return true if successful, false otherwise
171         */
172        public static boolean zoomExact(ImagePlus im, double magnification, int marginX, int marginY) {
173                ImageWindow win = im.getWindow();
174                if (null == win)
175                        return false;
176                ImageCanvas ic = win.getCanvas();
177                if (null == ic)
178                        return false;
179                
180                if (magnification <= 0.001) {
181                        return false;
182                }
183
184                // fit to screen
185                Dimension screen = Toolkit.getDefaultToolkit().getScreenSize();
186                int maxWidth  = screen.width - marginX;
187                int maxHeight = screen.height - marginY;
188                double w = Math.min(magnification * im.getWidth(), maxWidth);
189                double h = Math.min(magnification * im.getHeight(), maxHeight);
190                                
191                Rectangle sourceRect = new Rectangle(0, 0, (int) (w / magnification), (int) (h / magnification));
192                try {
193                        // by reflection:
194                        Field f_srcRect = ic.getClass().getDeclaredField("srcRect");
195                        f_srcRect.setAccessible(true);
196                        f_srcRect.set(ic, sourceRect);
197                        ic.setSize((int) w, (int) h);
198                        ic.setMagnification(magnification);
199                        win.pack();
200                        im.repaintWindow();
201                        return true;
202                }
203                catch (Exception e) { e.printStackTrace(); }
204                return false;
205        }
206        
207        /**
208         * Convenience method for {@link #zoomExact(ImagePlus, double, int, int)}
209         * using default screen margins.
210         * 
211         * @param im the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
212         * @param magnification the new magnification factor (1.0 = 100%)
213         * @return true if successful, false otherwise
214         */
215        public static boolean zoomExact(ImagePlus im, double magnification) {
216                return zoomExact(im, magnification, DEFAULT_SCREEN_MARGIN_X, DEFAULT_SCREEN_MARGIN_Y);
217        }
218        
219        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
220        
221        /**
222         * Retrieves the current magnification (zoom) factor for the given
223         * image window.
224         * 
225         * @param im the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
226         * @return the magnification factor
227         */
228        public static double getMagnification(ImagePlus im) {
229                return im.getWindow().getCanvas().getMagnification();
230        }
231
232        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------
233        
234        /**
235         * Captures the specified image window and returns it as a new {@link ImagePlus}
236         * instance. Uses ImageJ's built-in {@link ScreenGrabber} plugin.
237         * 
238         * @param im the image, which must be currently open (displayed)
239         * @return a new image with the grabbed contents
240         */
241        public static ImagePlus captureImage(ImagePlus im) {
242                return new ScreenGrabber().captureImage();
243        }
244        
245}
